method.name: atmosphere
method.shortdescription: Construct an atmosphere tool
method.description: This is used to construct an {\tt atmosphere} tool.

method.name: listAtmosphereTypes
method.shortdescription: Returns a list of atmospheric types used by ATM.
method.description: Returns a list of index numbers and corresponding atmosphere types used by the ATM library.
method.returns: List of index - atmosphere type pairs
method.example: \begin{verbatim} """ # at.listAtmosphereTypes() #['1 - tropical', '2 - midlatSummer', '3 - midlatWinter', # '4 - subarcticSummer', '5 - subarcticWinter'] # """ \end{verbatim}

method.name: initAtmProfile
method.shortdescription: Set initial atmospheric profile for atmosphere tool

param.name: altitude
param.description: Site altitude - Quantity with units of altitude, meter

param.name: temperature
param.description: Ambient Temperature - Quantity with units of temperature, K

param.name: pressure
param.description: Ambient pressure - Quantity with units of pressure

param.name: maxAltitude
param.description: altitude of the top pf the modelled atmosphere - Quantity with dimension of length, kilometer

param.name: humidity
param.description: used to guess water (0-100)

param.name: dTem_dh
param.description: the derivative of temperature with respect to height - Quantity with units of K/km

param.name: dP
param.description: initial pressure step - Quantity with the units of pressure, mb

param.name: dPm
param.description: pressure multiplicative factor for steps

param.name: h0
param.description: scale height for water( exp distribution ) - Quantity with the dimension of length, kilometer

param.name: atmType
param.description: atmospheric type 1(tropical),2(mid latitude summer),3(mid latitude winter), 4(subarctic summer),5(subarctic winter), dimensionless

method.example: \begin{verbatim} tmp = quantity(270.0,'K') pre = quantity(560.0,'mbar') hum = 20.0 alt = quantity(5000,'m') h0 = quantity(2.0,'km') wvl = quantity(-5.6,'K/km') mxA = quantity(48,'km') dpr = quantity(10.0,'mbar') dpm = 1.2 att = 1 myatm = at.initAtmProfile(alt, tmp, pre, mxA, hum, wvl, dpr, dpm, h0, att) \end{verbatim}

method.name: initSpectralWindow
method.shortdescription: initialize spectral window
method.description: function that defines a spectral window, computes absorption and emmision coefficients for this window, using the above atmospheric parameters.

param.name: nbands
param.description: number of spectral windows/bands

param.name: fCenter
param.description: center frequencies - Quantum with a vector value and unit of frequency, GHz

param.name: fWidth
param.description: frequency width of band - Quantum with a vector value and unit of frequency, GHz

param.name: fRes
param.description: resolution inside band - Quantum with a vector value and unit frequency, GHz. Default is for a single frequency.

method.returns: Number of layers in the atmospheric profile
method.example:
\begin{verbatim} nb=1 fC=quantity(88.,'GHz') fW=quantity(.5,'GHz') fR=quantity(.5,'GHz') at.initSpectralWindow(nb,fC,fW,fR)
nb=2 fC=quantity([88.,90.],'GHz') fW=quantity([.5,.5],'GHz') fR=quantity([.125,.125],'GHz') \end{verbatim}

method.name: addSpectralWindow
method.shortdescription: add a new spectral window
method.description: Add a new spectral window, uniformly sampled, this spectral window having no sideband.

param.name: fCenter
param.description: frequencies - Quantum with a vector value and unit of frequency, GHz

param.name: fWidth
param.description: frequency width - Quantum with a vector value and unit of frequency, GHz

param.name: fRes
param.description: resolution inside band - Quantum with a vector value and unit frequency, GHz

method.returns: Number of channels in new spectral window
method.example: \begin{verbatim} fC2 = quantity(350.0,'GHz') fW2 = quantity(0.008,'GHz') fR2 = quantity(0.002,'GHz') nc = at.addSpectralWindow(fC2,fW2,fR2) print "New spectral window has ", nc, " channels" \end{verbatim}

method.name: getDispersivePathLength
method.shortdescription: get the integrated Atmospheric Dispersive Path
method.description: Retrieve the integrated Atmospheric Path length (Dispersive part) along the atmospheric path corresponding to the 1st guess water column for channel nc in spectral window spwid.

param.name: nc
param.description: Channel number (0-based; defaults to reference channel)

param.name: spwid
param.description: Int standing for spectral window id (0-based)

method.returns: The integrated Atmoospheric Path Length for channel nc.
method.example:
\begin{verbatim} w = at.getStartupWaterContent() nb = 1 fC = quantity([850.0],'GHz') fW = quantity([0.5],'GHz') nfR = quantity([0.5],'GHz') at.initSpectralWindow(nb,fC,fW,fR) print "Total Dispersive Delay at ", fC.value, fC.units, " for 1.0 air mass: ", at.getDispersivePathLength().value / w.value, " meters per mm of water vapor" print "(",100*(at.getDispersivePathLength().value / w.value)/(at.getNonDispersivePathLength().value / w.value), "% of the Non-dispersive one )"
\end{verbatim}

\begin{verbatim} w = at.getStartupWaterContent() nb = 1 fC = quantity([850.0],'GHz') fW = quantity([0.5],'GHz') nfR = quantity([0.5],'GHz') at.initSpectralWindow(nb,fC,fW,fR) print "Total Dispersive Delay at ", fC.value, fC.units, " for 1.0 air mass: ", at.getDispersivePathLength().value / w.value, " meters per mm of water vapor" print "(",100*(at.getDispersivePathLength().value / w.value)/(at.getNonDispersivePathLength().value / w.value), "% of the Non-dispersive one )"
\end{verbatim}
